alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Smith and southeastern Phillips Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kensington to near Cedar. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Athol and Cedar around 530 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Gaylord and Harlan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
